alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 5:49PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Oahu in Honolulu County. * WHEN...Until 900 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM HST, radar indicated heavy showers over interior and southern sections of Oahu. Peak rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are occurring. Heavy showers will likely persist through sunset before diminishing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Honolulu, Waipio, Waipahu, Waikele, Pearl City, Kunia, Aiea, Iroquois Point, Halawa, Ewa Beach, Salt Lake, Mililani, Moanalua, Kapolei, Wheeler Field, Makakilo, Wahiawa, Kalihi, Schofield Barracks and Manoa. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 900 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
